text:
vim is easy in fact it's so easy i can show you 
how to use it in under one minute i use this

simple diagram to remind me of everything vim can 
do when you open up vim you start in normal mode

if you wish to go into insert mode simply press i 
I a A o O gI gi

s S C cc this will take you to 
insert mode where you can easily enter in text

to get back to normal mode you have one of a few 
options escape control c or control o by pressing

control c you will be fired from your job ctrl o 
will take you to insert normal mode in which you

can go to insert visual insert visual line insert 
visual block insert select insert select line or

insert select block with a simple key press and 
of course escape to go back to either insert or

normal mode in normal mode you can press the gh 
g capital h g control h to go into select select

line or select block mode respectively of course 
nobody has any idea what that is so quickly press

escape or control c to go back to normal mode or 
you can press ctrl g to go up to visual line or

visual block mode from there you can press escape 
or control c to go back to normal mode of course

you press v V or control v to go back to 
visual visual line or visual block mode and you
can press J gJ u U g? or some other operator to go back

to normal mode :! to go to command line 
mode or C c s S R I

or A to go into insert mode of course 
pressing lowercase r or gr will go into visual

replace character pending or visual virtual 
replace character pending mode respectively
once back in normal mode : ? / or :! will go into command line

mode from which you can go into all other modes 
depending on which commands you execute of course

in normal mode if you press Q you'll go into Ex 
mode Ex mode is harder to quit than vim is to quit

so therefore you should just simply power down 
your computer and call it a day see vim is easy
